title: [SplitChunkPlugin] priority does not affect actual entry dependencies
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**
Assuming we have entries "a" and "b" and two vendors "vendor-a" and "vendor-b". Entry "a" depends on "vendor-a" and entry "b" depends on "vendor-b", "vendor-b" itself also depends on "vendor-a". Now if we have such a cacheGroup "b" that captures both vendor modules, and one separate cacheGroup "a" for "vendor-a" specifically, adding higher ``priority`` to the cacheGroup "a" will correctly place "vendor-a" in the cacheGroup, however entry "a" will be still dependant on result of cacheGroup "b", i guess, because, it **possibly** can contain "vendor-a". See the example: https://github.com/MhMadHamster/webpack-minimal-example-rep

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**
clone example rep: https://github.com/MhMadHamster/webpack-minimal-example-rep run ``yarn start`` check that what i described above is true, then you can change configuration for cacheGroup with key "b" to this:
```javascript
b: {
  test: /vendor-b/,
  name: "vendor-b",
  enforce: true,
},
```
run ``yarn start`` again, the only thing that will change in the result code is that entry "a" is no more depends on "vendor-b" as expected, however "vendor-a" and "vendor-b" generated code stays the same.
<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**
If chunk moved to the cacheGroup via ``priority`` option, entries which require this chunk should not depend on the other cacheGroups, which could have that chunk unless ``priority``.

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version: 4.29.6
Node.js version: 8.11.3
Operating System: Windows 10
Additional tools:
